sentences.english: Generally speaking , the most pianists all accepted the professional training in the year one.
sentences.chinese: 大凡鋼琴家都在早年接受過專業訓練。

sentences.english: In itsearly years, it manufactured microscopes almost exclusively.
sentences.chinese: 早年這裏差不多隻生產顯微鏡。

sentences.english: And catch the early love up in the late .
sentences.chinese: 在遲暮的歲月裏趕上早年的愛情。

sentences.english: In his early days he abandoned medicine for literature.
His early life path became as twisted as the notorious mescal worm.
sentences.chinese: 他的早年生活變得跟惡名昭彰的龍舌蘭蟲一樣瘋狂？

sentences.english: His early years at the bar were very lean.
sentences.chinese: 他早年在律師界的工作毫無起色。

sentences.english: Memories of hard years made the old woman excessively thrifty.
sentences.chinese: 早年艱苦生活的回憶使這個老婦人極度儉省。

sentences.english: Her marriage effaced the memory of her earlier misfortunes.
sentences.chinese: 她的婚姻抹去了她早年種種不幸的記憶。

sentences.english: Many early American woodsmen wore buckskin clothing.
sentences.chinese: 許多早年的美國伐木人穿鹿皮衣服。

sentences.english: He lived a kind of superior living conditions in his early years.
sentences.chinese: 張岱出生於世宦之家，家境殷實，早年生活條件優越。

sentences.english: How active you are early in life may affect how able-minded you are late in life.
sentences.chinese: 一個人早年的活躍程度將影響到晚年的腦力健康。

sentences.english: He was born and spent his early years in Kenya.
sentences.chinese: 他在肯尼亞出生並在那度過了他的早年歲月。

sentences.english: When the Philharmonic's visit was announced, images of the Ping-Pong diplomacy of an earlier era were revived.
sentences.chinese: 當愛樂訪朝的消息公佈，早年乒乓外交的形象復甦了。

sentences.english: What's the difference between his critical attitude toward Xiong Shili in early years and in later years?
sentences.chinese: 他批評熊十力的態度在早年與晚年有什麼不同？

sentences.english: I don't remember much of those early years, but I do remember the rain.
sentences.chinese: 我不太記得早年的事情了，不過我還記得那雨。

sentences.english: This fact makes the choice of companions in early life more important even than that of teachers and guardians.
sentences.chinese: 因此早年擇友而交，比選擇老師和保護人更重要。

definition: to be born of/to come from/family background/class origin
to make one's mark/to go up in the world/to make one's fortune
in those days/then/in those years/during that time
once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
to make one's name/to become famous
representative individual (of a school of thought)
once/already/ever (in the past)/former/previously/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
to achieve fame among one's contemporaries (idiom); temporary or local celebrity
to be orphaned of one's father
